sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A faithful subjects sigh, on the universally-lamented death, and tragicall end, of that virtuous and pious prince, our most gracious soveraigne, Charles I. King of Great Brittaine, most barbarously butchered by his rebellious subjects. / By a gentleman now resident in the court of Spaine. Gentleman now resident in the court of Spaine.
[2], 5 [i.e. 6] p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1649.
In verse. Place of publication from Wing. P. 6 misnumbered 5. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 14". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[2], 5 [i.e. 6] p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1649.
In verse. Place of publication from Wing. P. 6 misnumbered 5. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 14". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
